comment._content: See also: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5126122996/] query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60E13F83C5913738... GIANT U.S. WARSHIP TAKES THE WATER; Gov. Cruce's Daughter, Half-Indian, Names the Fighting Oklahoma New York Times CAMDEN, N.J., March 23. -- "I christen thee Oklahoma," cried Miss Miss Lorena Jane Cruce, daughter of Gov. Cruce of the new western State, and as the bottle of champagne crashed smartly on the prow of the superdreadnought the cheers of patriotic Oklahomans vied with the whistles of tugs at the yards of the New York Shipbuilding Company. NOTE - If you read the full story at the link above, you will read that also present at the ill-fated USS Oklahoma's launching was "Assistant Secretary Roosevelt," that is Assistant Secretary of the Navy Franklin D. Roosevelt. Over 27 years later, USS Oklahoma would be sunk in the Japanese sneak-attack on Pearl Harbor, a day that the later-President Franklin D. Roosevelt would describe as a day which would "live in infamy."

comment._content: Lorena Jane Cruce (1895-1972), b. Ardmore, Picken County, Indian Territory, daughter of Governor Lee Cruce (1863-1933) and his wife, Chickie LeFlore (1871-1903); married in 1919 Joseph Herndon Norris (1891-1965). They had at least three children (Thomas, Lorena, and Lee). In 2007, her son Thomas Norris, and her granddaughter, Lorena Cruce Maldonado, traveled to Hawaii to dedicate the memorial for the USS Oklahoma, in Pearl Harbor. newsok.com/dedication-to-help-bring-one-family-full-circl...
